required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Compare the Glycemic Effects, Safety, and Tolerability of Exenatide Once Weekly to Those of Sitagliptin and Pioglitazone,in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Treated With Metformin (DURATION - 2)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, Multicenter Study to Compare the Glycemic Effects, Safety, and Tolerability of Exenatide Long-Acting Release(Once Weekly) to Those of Sitagliptin and a Thiazolidinedione in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Treated With Metformin

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the benefits of exenatide once weekly treatment to those achieved by the approved antidiabetic therapies sitagliptin and pioglitazone in subjects whose type 2 diabetes is managed with metformin therapy alone. The safety and tolerability of the three treatment regimens will also be compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26 [Week 26 - Baseline].

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7% at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <7% at Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5% at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <=6.5% at Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.0% at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <=6.0% at Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in systolic blood pressure from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diastolic blood pressure from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting total cholesterol from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting High-density Lipoprotein (HDL) From Baseline to Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting HDL from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Fasting Triglycerides at Week 26 to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 26 to baseline (Day 1). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.description: Major hypoglycemia: events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration < 54 mg/dL prior to treatment. Minor hypoglycemia: symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia and blood glucose concentration < 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Has a hemoglobin-specific A1c fraction (HbA1c) of 7.1% to 11.0%, inclusive, at study start
- Has a body mass index (BMI)of 25 kg/m2 to 45 kg/m2, inclusive, at study start
- Has been on a stable treatment regimen of metformin for a minimum of 2 months prior to study start
- Either is not treated with or has been on a stable treatment regimen with any of the following medications for a minimum of 2 months prior to study start:
1. Hormone replacement therapy (female subjects)
2. Oral contraceptives (female subjects)
3. Antihypertensive agents
4. Lipid-lowering agents
5. Thyroid replacement therapy
6. Antidepressant agents
7. Drugs known to affect body weight, including prescription medications (e.g. orlistat [XENICAL速], sibutramine [MERIDIA速], topiramate [TOPAMAX速]) and over-the-counter antiobesity agents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has been previously exposed to exenatide once weekly
- Has donated blood within 60 days of study start or is planning to donate blood during the study
- Currently being treated, or is expected to require or undergo treatment with any of the following treatment-excluded medications:
1. Exenatide (BYETTA速) or any Dipeptidyl peptidase-4 DPP-4)inhibitor, sulfonylurea (SU), thiazolidinedione (TZD), or glucagon-like peptide (GLP)-1 analog within 3 months prior to study start
2. Alpha-glucosidase inhibitor, meglitinide, nateglinide, or pramlintide (SYMLIN速) within 30 days of study start
3. Insulin within 2 weeks of study start or for more than 1 week within 3 months of study start
4. Systemic corticosteroids by oral, intravenous, or intramuscular route; or potent, inhaled, or intrapulmonary (including ADVAIR速) steroids known to have a high rate of systemic absorption
5. Drugs interacting with the CYP2C8 enzyme system, including gemfibrozil (LOPID速) and rifampin
- Has received any investigational drug within 1 month (or five half-lives of investigational drug, whichever is greater) of study start
- Has previously experienced a clinically significant adverse event (e.g., significant edema) related to TZD or DPP-4 inhibitor use

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Exenatide once weekly 2 mg subcutaneous weekly plus placebo oral once daily in the morning

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

group.title: Pioglitazone
group.description: Pioglitazone 45 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

group.description: Exenatide once weekly 2 mg subcutaneous weekly plus placebo oral once daily in the morning

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26
outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26 [Week 26 - Baseline].
outcome.population: The ITT Population included randomized subjects who received at least one injection of study medication. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Exenatide once weekly 2 mg subcutaneous weekly plus placebo oral once daily in the morning

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

group.title: Pioglitazone
group.description: Pioglitazone 45 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 26
measure.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26 [Week 26 - Baseline].
measure.population: The ITT Population included randomized subjects who received at least one injection of study medication. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Alternative hypothesis: a difference exists between exenatide once weekly and at least one comparator group (sitagliptin or pioglitazone). Power: Assuming 10% dropout, delta=0.5%, and common SD=1.2%, 450 subjects would provide >90% power to detect a treatment difference (alpha=0.05, two-sided) in the change in HbA1c between exenatide once weekly and sitagliptin or pioglitazone, with Hochberg's multiplicity adjustment method.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) model includes treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Alternative hypothesis: a difference exists between exenatide once weekly and at least one comparator group (sitagliptin or pioglitazone). Power: Assuming 10% dropout, delta=0.5%, and common SD=1.2%, 450 subjects would provide >90% power to detect a treatment difference (alpha=0.05, two-sided) in the change in HbA1c between exenatide once weekly and sitagliptin or pioglitazone, with Hochberg's multiplicity adjustment method.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) model includes treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7% at Week 26
outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <7% at Week 26.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement. Subjects without post-baseline HbA1c measurement were categorized as not achieving goal.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Exenatide once weekly 2 mg subcutaneous weekly plus placebo oral once daily in the morning

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

group.title: Pioglitazone
group.description: Pioglitazone 45 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7% at Week 26
measure.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <7% at Week 26.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement. Subjects without post-baseline HbA1c measurement were categorized as not achieving goal.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target of <7% at Week 26 were compared between treatments using a Cochran Mantel Haenszel (CMH) test, in which baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%) and country served as stratification factors. Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Power: based on the primary measurement.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target of <7% at Week 26 were compared between treatments using a Cochran Mantel Haenszel (CMH) test, in which baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%) and country served as stratification factors. Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Power: based on the primary measurement.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.

measure.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 26
measure.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in body weight from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26 was analyzed by an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model including treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors, and baseline value of body weight as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Power: based on the primary measurement.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in body weight from baseline (Day 1) to Week 26 was analyzed by an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model including treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors, and baseline value of body weight as a covariate. measure.title: Ratio of Fasting Triglycerides at Week 26 to Baseline
measure.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 26 to baseline (Day 1). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 26 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Triglycerides data were logarithm-transformed and the change at Week 26 to baseline (Day 1), expressed as the ratio, was analyzed by an ANCOVA model including treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors, and baseline value of fasting triglycerides as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Power: based on the primary measurement.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Triglycerides data were logarithm-transformed and the change at Week 26 to baseline (Day 1), expressed as the ratio, was analyzed by an ANCOVA model including treatment, country, and baseline HbA1c stratum (<9.0% or >=9.0%) as factors, and baseline value of fasting triglycerides as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference across treatments. Power: based on the primary measurement.
analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted p-value was derived using Hochberg's procedure for multiple treatment comparisons.

Minor hypoglycemia: symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia and blood glucose concentration < 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

measure.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events
measure.description: Major hypoglycemia: events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration < 54 mg/dL prior to treatment. Minor hypoglycemia: symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia and blood glucose concentration < 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Exenatide once weekly 2 mg subcutaneous weekly plus placebo oral once daily in the morning

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

group.title: Pioglitazone
group.description: Pioglitazone 45 mg oral once daily in the morning plus placebo once weekly subcutaneous weekly

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
